text: , is the name of a Japanese artificial satellite which was put into orbit. The launch was a project of the Institute of Space and Astronautical Science of the University of Tokyo. The satellite was sent into orbit on August 30, 1991.JAXA, "Catalogue of ISAS Missions" ; retrieved 2012-4-16. Its mission was to study the sun. On September 12, 2005 the spacecraft burned up during reentry. ==References== == Other websites == * Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA), Yohkoh (Solar-A) mission profile Category:Japanese satellites Category:Spacecraft launched in the 1990s
title: Yohkoh
